case_title: MUHAMMAD FAROOQ vs THE STATE and another
reference_no_or_id: Criminal Miscellaneous No. 255 of 2007, Petition No. 100 of 2006

accussed_details.name: MUHAMMAD FAROOQ
allegation: Criminal offense under sections 338-E, 309, 310, and 311 of P.P.C.

complaint_summary: The case involves a criminal offense where the petitioner-convict was accused under sections 338-E, 309, 310, and 311 of P.P.C. The matter pertains to a compromise between legal heirs of the deceased.
investigation_summary: The investigation revealed that the father of the deceased waived his right, while the mother did not. The mother is entitled to Badl-i-Sulh/compensation.
judgment_summary: The court directed the petitioner-convict to deposit Rs. 300,000 as Badl-i-Sulh with the Registrar of the Supreme Court of Pakistan by 22-11-2007. The case was to be re-listed for further considerations after the deposit.
punishment: Deposit of Rs. 300,000 as Badl-i-Sulh compensation.
Decision_or_verdict: Order accordingly. The case is not of Qisas but Ta'zir, requiring compromise from all legal heirs.
legal_arguments: Reference to sections 338-E, 309, 310, and 311 of P.P.C.
Discussion on the entitlement of Badl-i-Sulh/compensation.
Clarification that the case falls under Ta'zir, not Qisas.
key_issues: Requirement of compromise from all legal heirs.
Classification of the case as Ta'zir instead of Qisas.

legal_terms.Badl-i-Sulh: Compensation paid as part of a compromise in criminal cases.
legal_terms.Ta'zir: Punishment determined by the court, not fixed by Islamic law.

words_and_phrases.Compromise: Agreement between parties to settle the matter.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves a compromise under Ta'zir law, requiring all legal heirs to agree. The petitioner-convict was directed to pay Rs. 300,000 as Badl-i-Sulh compensation to the mother of the deceased. Further proceedings were scheduled after the deposit.
